King of the NÄgas!
Observe this world, where various karmic activities all arise from delusion;

Dragon King!
All those forms are due to the various transformations of each individual's mind, based on their good and evil physical, verbal, and mental actions;
Although these mental factors are said to have forms, they are like illusions and cannot be grasped.
Dragon King!
These forms and all phenomena are originally unborn and have no controller;
Moreover, they have no self and are also unobstructed.
Thus, various karmic actions and the intrinsic nature of phenomena are all illusory appearances, inconceivable.
Dragon King!

If there are bodhisattvas who know that all dharmas are unborn, unceasing, formless, and signless, and having realized this as it truly is, they engage in all wholesome actions without any sense of action;
they do not see any form, characteristics, aggregates, sense bases, elements, or phenomena of arising;

Such retribution is caused by karma and dominated by karma.
You should cause sentient beings to give rise to a mind of wisdom, to do and cultivate according to the study of good karma;
Not to create or abide in wrong views;
Know that those wrong views are not ultimate.
Having known this, all sentient beings should seek to be teachers and come to make offerings, and will attain offerings of reverence and faith in the heavens and among humans.
NÄga Lord!
There is one dharma that can cause sentient beings to sever all the karma of evil destinies.
What is the one dharma?
It is called observing good dharmas.
How should one observe those good dharmas?
One should observe one's own body.
Whether walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, day and night, the thoughts and intentions I give rise to are not without transgression.
In this way, be aware and do not allow unwholesome dharmas to arise in the four deportments.
In this way, having completely severed all unwholesome dharmas, one should cause wholesome dharmas to be fully possessed.

Moreover, one should cause all sentient beings who are the same in wholesomeness to attain the stages of Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas, up to the unsurpassed perfect supreme enlightenment.
NÄga Lord!
What are wholesome dharmas?
I will now explain them.
Namely, the ten wholesome courses of action are the fundamental basis for all;
they are the fundamental basis for being born in the heavens and among humans;
they are the fundamental basis for the supreme wholesome dharmas of the world and beyond the world;
they are the fundamental basis for Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas;
they are the fundamental basis for the unsurpassed perfect supreme enlightenment.
What is their fundamental basis?
Namely, the ten wholesome courses of action.

If one can stay far away from killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, frivolous speech, harsh speech, divisive speech, up to greed, ill-will, and wrong views, if one can stay far away in this way, this is the ten wholesome courses of action;

NÄga Lord!
Men and individuals who stay far away from killing obtain ten kinds of wholesome dharmas.
What are the ten dharmas?
They are: obtaining the giving of fearlessness;

obtaining right practice, obtaining the thought of not arousing the faults of all sentient beings;
obtaining little illness;
happily obtaining a long life;
obtaining various non-humans who act as protectors;
in sleep and waking, all are peaceful and secure;
further, obtaining the protection of the sages, the mind does not abandon them;
in sleep and dreams, one does not see the affairs of evil karma and suffering;
One attains fearlessness towards all evil destinies;
After death, one is reborn in the heavens.
NÄga Lord!
Men and women who obtain these ten kinds of good dharmas, practice the bodhisattva path, and attain the abiding of the good mind;
When the roots of goodness are mature, they will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
NÄga Lord!
Men and women who avoid stealing obtain ten bases of Dharma.
What are the ten?
They are: attaining great wealth and self-mastery, attaining freedom from the difficulties of kings, freedom from the difficulties of water, fire, thieves, and enemies;
attaining many harmonious and amicable relatives;
attaining the love and affection of many people, without mutual suffering or distress, and whatever they say is all believed;
attaining the accumulation of immeasurable wealth and treasures;
attaining praise from all directions;
attaining fearlessness and confidence in all activities;
to be praised by others as wise;
to attain physical strength, longevity, and eloquence;
to be impartial towards friends and strangers, without causing harm;

Dragon King!
Men and women who abstain from stealing will attain these ten principles of reliance.
Through these wholesome roots, they will be able to realize the Buddha's teachings and attain unsurpassed perfect supreme enlightenment.
Dragon King!
Men and women who abstain from sexual misconduct will attain four kinds of wisdom and wholesome dharmas.
What are the four?
They are: subduing the senses;
being free from distraction;
being praised by the world;
and having innumerable followers.
Dragon King!
Men and women who abstain from sexual misconduct will attain these four kinds of wisdom and wholesome dharmas;
With this wholesome root, they will attain unsurpassed perfect supreme enlightenment;

Men and individuals who avoid false speech will attain eight kinds of wholesome dharmas in the heavens and among humans.

A man or woman who abstains from frivolous speech will attain three kinds of one-sided dharmas.
What are the three?

Men and women who are free from the poison of anger will be able to fulfill five kinds of supreme vows.

First, one's words will not be sincere; second, people will not believe or revere them.

If one engages in frivolous speech, one will fall into the hells, the realm of animals, or the realm of Yama. Later, when reborn among humans due to remaining karma, one will obtain two kinds of retributions:
First, one's words will not be genuine; second, one's words will be uncertain.

First, one's words will be prone to quarrels; second, people will not respect what one says.

First, one's mind will always be unhappy; second, many things will not be as one wishes.
